statements: SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, job_title FROM employees ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Marketing';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 10;
SELECT DISTINCT department FROM employees;
SELECT name, job_title FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE job_title = 'Manager' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees WHERE job_title LIKE '%Engineer%' ORDER BY department ASC, name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE manager_id IS NULL;
SELECT name, job_title, department FROM employees WHERE manager_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='HR';
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees WHERE manager_id IS NOT NULL;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE employee_id IN (SELECT employee_id FROM relationships WHERE relationship_type='Colleague');
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, m.name AS manager_name FROM employees e JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id;
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, r.relationship_type FROM employees e JOIN relationships r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id WHERE r.relationship_type = 'Supervisor';

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, r.relationship_type, re.name AS related_employee_name FROM employees e JOIN relationships r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id JOIN employees re ON r.related_employee_id = re.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, position FROM employees WHERE department='IT';
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE position='Manager' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT name, position, department FROM employees WHERE department='HR' AND position='Analyst';
SELECT employee_id, name, position, department FROM employees WHERE manager_id IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE position = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_id, name, department, position FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT e.name, e.department, d.location FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.name WHERE e.position = 'Engineer';
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, m.name AS manager_name FROM employees e JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employee_relationships WHERE relationship_type = 'Supervisor' ORDER BY employee_id1 DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_id, name, department_id FROM employee_department ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM company_hierarchy WHERE supervisor_id IS NULL;
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE manager_id IS NULL ORDER BY name DESC;

SELECT employees.name, departments.name FROM employees INNER JOIN employee_department ON employees.employee_id = employee_department.employee_id INNER JOIN departments ON employee_department.department_id = departments.department_id;
SELECT DISTINCT e.name, d.name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_department ed ON e.employee_id = ed.employee_id LEFT JOIN departments d ON ed.department_id = d.department_id;
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, m.name AS manager_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT employee_id, name, role FROM Employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT name, department FROM Employees ORDER BY department ASC;
SELECT name, task_description FROM Employees INNER JOIN Responsibilities ON Employees.employee_id = Responsibilities.employee_id;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM Employees;
SELECT * FROM Employees ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT employee_id, name, role, department FROM Employees WHERE department='HR';

SELECT e.name, d.name as department, t.name as team, p.name as project FROM ((Employees e JOIN Teams t ON e.employee_id = t.leader_id) JOIN Projects p ON t.team_id = p.team_id) JOIN Departments d ON t.department_id = d.department_id;
SELECT count(*) as num_projects, round(avg(deadline - CURRENT_DATE),2) as avg_days_to_deadline FROM Responsibilities;
SELECT e.name, r.task_description FROM Employees e JOIN Responsibilities r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id WHERE deadline <= '2022-12-31';
